指南 Guide.text:
This is a work compiled primarily from information in 三國職官表 “List of official positions of Three Kingdoms” by Qing scholar 洪飴孫 Hong Yisun

@ Zhou Gongjin

Court Gentleman Prefect

Minister of the Household

Court Gentleman Prefect

Minister of the Household
Fifth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

黑：屬官
Black: Secondary Officials subordinate to Dignitary officials
Attendant Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Attendant Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 400 dan, not fixed

藍：從吏
Blue: Minor Officials subordinate to Secondary officials

月俸 Salary

Salary Table of the Han. Estimation for missing values/adjusted values by Bielenstein [1] in blue.

1. The salaries of the officials (Chapter 5) - The Bureaucracy of Han Times
2. 《漢書·百官公卿表》(Book of Han, Table of nobility ranks and government offices)
3. 《後漢書·百官志》 (Book of the Later Han, Treatise of the Hundred Offices)

三國制 Three Kingdoms Standards:

里: 1 li ≈ 430m

丈: 1 zhang ≈ 240cm

斤: 1 jin ≈ 220g
石: Salary rank measured in dan (sometimes also known as shi). In salaries used as a volume unit equivalent to 斛 hu, which is about 20 litres

開府: To open an office -- Creation of one’s staff to operate a mini-official subordinate system outside the imperial court. Officials able to do so are usually high-ranking ones, such as the Excellencies.
Monthly Salary - Unhusked Grain (hu) [Former Han,Later Han AD 50 or both]1 2
Monthly Salary in Coin [Later Han 106 AD] 2 3
Monthly Salary in Husked Grain (hu) [Later Han 106 AD] 2 3
斗食 Lit. Paid in Dou

上公 Superior Excellency.text:
Chancellor of State

Excellency over the Masses
Support and assist the emperor in managing all affairs

魏黃初元年改為司徒，甘露五年復置相國
The Wei in the 1st year of Huangchu changed to Excellency over the Masses, in the 5th year of Ganlu restored to Chancellor

司馬昭始置
First established by Sima Zhao

古時凡同輩之長皆曰祭酒
In the past all seniors of their peers were called Libationers
Advisor on the Front, Rear, Middle
Advisor on the Front, Rear, Middle
Fifth grade, Rear 1 person, Middle 2 people

蜀軍師或不屬丞相
Shu's Advisors might not be under the Chancellor
Advisor on the Left, Right, Advisor
Advisor on the Left, Right, Advisor, Deputy Advisor
五品，左右一人、軍師無員
Fifth grade, Left & Right 1 person each, not fixed for Advisor

吳軍師皆不屬丞相
Wu's Advisors were all not under the Chancellor
Assist in supervising officials in the various provinces
Manage matters in the various sections
六品，千石，（魏）二人，（蜀、吳）一人
Sixth grade, 1000 dan, (Wei) 2 people, (Shu, Wu) 1 person
六品，千石，（魏）各一人，（蜀）一人
Sixth grade, 1000 dan, (Wei) 1 person each, (Shu) 1 person

魏咸熙元年增置左右
Wei added left and right in the 1st year of Xianxi
六品，千石，（魏）二人，（蜀）或一人
Sixth grade, 1000 dan, (Wei) 2 people, (Shu) maybe 1 person

主簿久次者為之
Registrars who were in office for a long time may hold this position

參軍久次者為之
Army Adjutants who were in office for a long time may hold this position
七品，（魏）二十二人，（蜀）無員
七品，掾比四百石，屬二百石，（魏）各一人，（蜀）無考
Seventh grade, Administrator Equivalent to 400 dan, Assistant 200 dan,  (Wei) 1 person each, (Shu) unknown

通典：正曰掾，副曰属
Tongdian: Chief officials are called Administrators (掾) and their deputies are called Assistants (屬)

後漢書：西曹主府史署用。東曹主二千石長吏遷除及軍吏
Houhanshu: The Western Section appoints officials in the Office [of the Chancellor], the Eastern Section appoints 2000 dan high-ranking officers and military officers.
In charge of household registers, worship and agriculture
七品，掾一人比三百石，屬二人二百石
Seventh grade, Administrator 1 person,  Equivalent to 300 dan, Assistant 2 people, 200 dan
In charge of banditry and thievery matters
In charge of currency casting, salt and iron matters
七品，掾一人比三百石，屬一人二百石
Seventh grade, Administrator 1 person,  Equivalent to 300 dan, Assistant 1 person, 200 dan
Manage horses and various livestock in the outer warehouses
七品，掾二人比三百石，屬一人二百石
Seventh grade, Administrator 2 people,  Equivalent to 300 dan, Assistant 1 person, 200 dan
七品，掾一人比三百石，屬一人二百石
Seventh grade, Administrator 1 person,  Equivalent to 300 dan, Assistant 1 person, 200 dan
In charge of postal and statute matters
In charge of memorials and discussion matters
In charge of granaries and grain matters
魏七品，二百石，二人，蜀一人
Wei seventh grade, 200 dan, 2 people, Shu 1 person

延康以來置否，無考
Establishments since the Yankang era not known
Military Strategy Section Administrator/ Military Discussion Section Administrator
Treachery Inspection Section Administrator of the Right/Foreman Clerk

魏、吳又有校事，不屬丞相
Wei and Wu also had Investigators, though they were not under the Chancellor
In charge of affairs within the [Chancellor's] cabinet

不常設；蜀惟章武前，不開府
Not always filled; This position only existed in Shu before the Zhangwu era, and had no office
Manage matters in the various sections

嘉平二年增置左右
Added left and right in the 2nd year of Jiaping
Grade and salary same as respective positions in the Chancellor's Office, total 10 people
Guide and protect the rulers, advising them on virtue and righteousness

景元四年始置，不常設
First established in the 4th year of Jingyuan, not always filled
Manage matters in the various sections
Grade and salary same as respective positions in the Chancellor's Office, numbers unknown

魏惟曹氏為之，公孫淵虛職而已；吳赤烏九年分置左右，建興中復舊
Wei only had Cao clan members fill this position, Gongsun Yuan was only given this as an honorary title; Wu in the 9th year of Chiwu split into left and right, reverted back during the Jianxing era
Manage matters in the various sections

蜀亦有前部、後部司馬 、營司馬，府屬不明
Shu also had Major of the Front/Rear divisions & Major of the Camp, their subordination unclear

通典分正行
The Tongdian further split into Main and Acting

通典：除拜則為參軍事，府板則為行參軍。
Tongdian: Court appointments were [Main] Army Adjutants, while appointments by the Offices themselves would be Acting Army Adjutants.

Eastern Section Administrator

Military Strategy Section Administrator

Grand General

Grand General on the Right

魏大將軍初位太尉上，司馬師為大將軍，以叔父孚為太尉，始奏改在太尉下；蜀景耀初復分置右大將軍
Wei's Grand General was originally ranked above the Grand Commandant. When Sima Shi was the Grand General, because his uncle Fu was Grand Commandant, petitioned to be ranked below the Grand Commandant; Shu separately established the Grand General on the Right at the beginning of Jingyao era

黃初二年拜孫權為大將軍。是時曹仁為之，乃員外置
In the 2nd year of Huangchu conferred Sun Quan as Grand General. At the time Cao Ren was holding this position, this is an appointment beyond the fixed staff
Seventh grade,  Equivalent to 400 dan, 1 person

同丞相府，西曹主府史署用，東曹主二千石長吏遷除
Same as the Chancellor's Office, the Western Section appoints officials in the Office, the Eastern Section appoints 2000 dan high-ranking officers
In charge of household registers, worship and agriculture
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, 1 person

魏共十曹，皆司馬師為大將軍時置
Wei had a total of 10 Sections, all established when Sima Shi was the Grand General
In charge of banditry and thievery matters
In charge of currency casting, salt and iron matters
Manage horses and various livestock in the outer warehouses
In charge of granaries and grain matters
Manage matters in the various sections

正元初增置左右
Added left and right at the beginning of Zhengyuan era

魏景元四年增至二人
Wei expanded in the 4th year of Jingyuan to become 2 people

魏景元四年增至四人
Wei expanded in the 4th year of Jingyuan to become 4 people

通典分正行
The Tongdian further split into Main and Acting
In charge of preparing to-be-submitted memorials, reports and documents

營軍都督

刺姦都督

帳下都督

Commander of the Garrisoned Army

Commander of Treachery Inspection

Commander Under the Tent
In charge of affairs within the [Chancellor's] cabinet

魏景元四年增至十餘人
Wei expanded in the 4th year of Jingyuan to become more than 10 people

三公 Three Excellencies.text:
通典：漢制三公一歲萬石
Tongdian: By Han standards, the Three Exllencies had an annual salary of 10000 dan

魏、吳以太尉、司徒、司空為三公；蜀國以大司馬﹑大將軍﹑司徒為三公
Wei and Wu had Grand Commandant, Excellency over the Masses and Excellency of Works as the Three Excellencies; Shu had Grand Marshal, Grand General and Excellency over the Masses as the Three Excellencies

蜀不常設
Not always filled in Shu
Manage matters in the various sections

本一人，魏末增置左右
Originally one person, near the end of Wei added left and right

通典分正行
The Tongdian further split into Main and Acting

營軍都督

刺姦都督

帳下都督

Commander of the Garrisoned Army

Commander of Treachery Inspection

Commander Under the Tent
In charge of affairs within the [Chancellor's] cabinet

Excellency over the Masses

Grand Excellency over the Masses
Manage matters in the various sections

通典分正行
The Tongdian further split into Main and Acting
Seventh grade,  Equivalent to 400 dan, 1 person
Seventh grade,  Equivalent to 300 dan, 1 person

俱太祖時
All during the time of Cao Cao
Manage matters in the various sections

通典分正行
The Tongdian further split into Main and Acting
Seventh grade,  Equivalent to 400 dan, 1 person
In charge of household registers, worship and agriculture
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, 1 person
In charge of granaries and grain matters

太祖時又有記室，後時置否，無考。
During Cao Cao's time there was also Record Keeper, unknown if also established in later times

文散官 Civil Honorary Officials.text: With Prestige Equal to the Three Excellencies
加官，加是官者皆以本官開府
Additional title, all those with this title can open office with their original official positions
加官。以功德特進見，賜諸侯功德優異朝廷所敬異者，在三公下
Additional title. [Officials are] specially advanced with exceptional merits, often granted to those highly respected by the court with outstanding merits, ranked below the Three Excellencies

諸官加特進者，從本官供給，特進但為班位而已，不別有吏卒車服
Various officials with Specially Advanced titles followed their original posititons’ salary, Specially Advanced is only for their standing positions in court, did not have special officials, servants, chariots or clothes

光祿大夫

左、右光祿大夫

Household Counsellor

Household Counsellor on the Left/Right

職掌言誥，毗亮論道，獻可替否，贊揚德化

諸公吿老，皆家拜此位，及在朝顯職，復用加之

Manage official announcements, assist in policy discussions, offer opinions on what is acceptable or not, praise virtuous conducts and moralize the masses

When the various excellencies retire, all would be conferred this position at home, court officials with prominent positions will also be added this position as a demonstration of favor
Third grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, not fixed

先掌弔問，魏氏以來，轉復優重，不復以為使命之官
Originally also responsible for sending condolences on behalf of the emperor, since the Wei, this position was changed to one of preferential treatment and respect, no longer having outbound duties

魏靑龍中分置左右，後還復舊
Wei during the Qinglong era split into left and right, later reverted back to the former system

蜀譙周雖為光祿，位亞九列，或與魏制異
Shu's Qiao Zhou although as a Household Councellor, was ranked below the Nine Ministers, the Shu system may be different from the Wei system

三國會要：魏晉光祿皆銀章青綬，其重者加金章紫綬，謂金紫光祿大夫
Compendium of the Three Kingdoms: Household Counsellors of the Wei-Jin era all had silver seals and green ribbons, those of special importance were given gold seals and purple ribbons, and known as the Gold and Purple Household Counsellor

九卿(一) Nine Ministers I.text:
通典：後漢九卿而分屬三司，太常、光祿勳、衛尉三卿並太尉所部；太僕、廷尉、大鴻臚三卿並司徒所部；宗正、大司農、少府三卿並司空所部。魏九卿與漢同。
Tongdian: The Later Han’s Nine Ministers were under the respective Three Excellencies. The Minister of Ceremonies, Minister of the Household, Commandant of the Guards were under the Grand Commandant; the Minister Coachman, Commandant of Justice, Minister Herald were under the Excellency over the Masses; the Minister for Imperial Clansmen, Minister of Agriculture, Minister of the Lesser Treasury were under the Excellency of Works. Wei’s Nine Ministers were the same as the Han.

魏、吳為王時為奉常，称帝后改太常
When Wei and Wu were still kings they had Upholder of Ceremonies, after ascension changed to Minister of Ceremonies
Assistant to the Minister of Ceremonies
掌行禮及祭祀小事，總署曹事
Manage execution of rituals and trivial matters in worships,  oversee matters in the various sections
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
Erudite for the Minister of Ceremonies
掌引導乘輿，王公已下應追謚者議定之
In charge of guiding the emperor, and deciding the appropriate posthumous names for those ranked below Kings and Excellencies

與太學博士不同
Different from the Imperial Academy Erudite
以博士之聡明有威重者為之，掌國子學
Held by Erudites who were intelligent and august, manage the Academy for the Sons of the State

太學亦曰國子學，太學博士祭酒亦稱國子祭酒
The Imperial Academy is also known as Academy for the Sons of the State, and the Imperial Academy Erudite Libationer also called Erudite Libationer of the Academy for the Sons of the State
Teaching the five classics to the various disciples
（魏）五品，比六百，十九人，（蜀、吳）無考
(Wei) Fifth grade, Equivalent to 600 dan, 19 people, (Shu & Wu) unknown

魏黃初五年立太學，置五經課試之法，門人滿三年通一經者稱弟子；蜀吳惟稱博士
Wei established the Imperial Academy in the 5th year of Huangchu, and implemented the Five Classics Examinations, students who mastered one classic after studying for three years are called disciples; Shu and Wu only addressed as Erudite
擧麾節樂，調和律呂，監試樂人典課
Craft and direct music, tune instruments, invigilate exams for official musicians
掌天時星暦，奏良日及時節禁忌，記瑞應災異
Manage celestial time and calendars, propose auspicious days and prohibited times, record auspicious omens and peculiar disasters

Astronomical Observer Gentleman

Astronomical Observation Department Clerk
Director of the Imperial Ancestral Temple

Director of the Temple of Emperor Gao

Director of the Temple of Emperor Zhaolie
Director of the Imperial Ancestral Temple
Guard the temple, arrange and clean altars
Reciting blessings, welcoming and bidding farewell to deities
Manage prayer matters of minor deities
Manage music performances and their playing sequence
Assistant to the Grand Director of Music
Guard the mausoleum, arrange and clean altars
Seventh grade, 600 dan, 1 person per mausoleum
Assistant to the Mausoleum Town Prefect

Court Gentleman Prefect

Minister of the Household

Court Gentleman Prefect

Minister of the Household
宿衛宮殿門戶，主諸郎之在殿中侍衛者
Guard the palace halls, in charge of the various attendants that serve and guard within the palace halls

魏、吳為王時為郎中令，称帝后改光祿勛
When Wei and Wu were still kings they had Court Gentleman Prefect, after ascension changed to Minister of Household
Assistant to the Minister of Household
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
In charge of the Gentleman for All Purposes
Fourth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

文帝為五官中郎將時有長史、文学、司馬、賊曹、功曹，踐阼以後不置
When Emperor Wen was Gentleman-General for All Purposes, subordinates included Chief Clerk, Literary Scholar Section Assistant, Major, Banditry Section Assistant and Merit Section Assistant, all were not established after his enthronement

與左右中郎將共稱三署，屬郎為三署郎
Together with the Gentleman-General on the Left & Right known as the Three Departments, and the Gentlemen under them known as the Three Department Gentlemen

主更直，宿衛諸殿門，出充車騎

又，實為後備，以供選用

In charge of patrol shifts, guard the various palace hall gates, serve as aides when the emperor goes out

Also often in reality a title for reserve official for future selection and appointment
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 600 dan, not fixed

皆謂五官郎
They were all known as the Gentleman for All Purposes
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 400 dan, not fixed
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, not fixed
In charge of the Left Department Gentleman
Fourth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

漢末、魏制，左中郎將駐東境，或作東中郎將
Per end of Han and Wei standards, the Gentleman-General on the Left was stationed in the east, hence sometimes written as Gentleman-General in the East

主更直，宿衛諸殿門，出充車騎

又，實為後備，以供選用

In charge of patrol shifts, guard the various palace hall gates, serve as aides when the emperor goes out

Also often in reality a title for reserve official for future selection and appointment
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 600 dan, not fixed

皆謂左署郎
They were all known as the Left Department Gentleman
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 400 dan, not fixed
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, not fixed
In charge of the Right Department Gentleman
Fourth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

漢末、魏制，右中郎將駐西境，或作西中郎將
Per end of Han and Wei standards, the Gentleman-General on the Right was stationed in the west, hence sometimes written as Gentleman-General in the West

主更直，宿衛諸殿門，出充車騎

又，實為後備，以供選用

In charge of patrol shifts, guard the various palace hall gates, serve as aides when the emperor goes out

Also often in reality a title for reserve official for future selection and appointment
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 600 dan, not fixed

皆謂右署郎
They were all known as the Right Department Gentleman
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 400 dan, not fixed
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, not fixed
In charge of matters in the Three Departments

於諸郎之中，察茂才高第者為之。次補尚書郎，出宰百里
Among the various gentlemen, those deemed exceptionally talented and of the highest merit are selected for this position. They can be subsequently promoted to Imperial Secretariat Gentleman, and leave to administer over 100 li.
Fourth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

南北二中郎將下，疑無所屬，又其中郎等有無，無考。
Under the Gentleman-General in the North & South, it is suspected to not have any subordinate officials, also not known whether they have Gentleman subordinates
Fourth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

南北二中郎將下，疑無所屬，又其中郎等有無，無考。
Under the Gentleman-General in the North & South, it is suspected to not have any subordinate officials, also not known whether they have Gentleman subordinates
In charge of the Rapid Tiger Gentleman
Fifth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

通典：舊曰虎奔，言如虎之奔
Tongdian: Formerly called "sprint like tiger”, said to be similar to the rapid sprinting of tigers.
Inner Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Inner Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 600 dan, not fixed

皆謂虎賁郎
They were all known as the Rapid Tiger Gentleman

漢武帝置期門郎，平帝更名虎賁
Emperor Wu of Han established Gentleman at the Gates, Emperor Ping changed its name to Rapid Tigers
Attendant Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Attendant Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 400 dan, not fixed
Court Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Court Gentleman of the Rapid Tigers
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, not fixed

羽林中郎將

羽林左、右部督

Gentleman-General of the Feathered Forest

Commander of the Feathered Forest Left/Right Division
(Wei) In charge of the Feathred Forest Gentleman
（魏）五品，比二千石，一人 （蜀）督各一人，其餘無考 （吳) 一人 ，其餘無考
(Wei) Fifth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person (Shu) Commanders 1 person each, rest unknown (Wu) 1 person, rest unknown

通典：言其為國羽翼，如林之盛；顏師古：如羽之疾，如林之多。
Tongdian: It is said to be the state’s feathered wings, flourishing like a forest. Yan Shigu: Swift as arrows, numerous as a forest.

蔡质汉仪：府次虎贲府
Cai Zhi's Hanyi: the Feathered Forest is second to the Rapid Tigers.
Guard the palace, accompany and serve the emperor
Eighth grade, Equivalent to 300 dan, not fixed
Superintendent of the Feathered Forest on the Left/Right
(Wei) In charge of the Feathered Forest Left and Right Cavalry
（魏）五品，六百石，各一人 （蜀）一人，其餘無考
(Wei) Fifth grade, 600 dan, 1 person each (Shu) 1 person, rest unknown

Superintendent of the Tiger Strides

Superintendent of the Tiger Cavalry

按考古印章，亦有虎步司馬等官，或與魏虎豹騎似
According to seals from archaelogy findings, there were also positions like Major of the Tiger Strides, this Tiger Strides may be similar to Wei's Tiger and Leopard Cavalry

孫權有詔五千繞帳﹑帳下﹑解煩兵歸繞帳張溫
Sun Quan had an edict to have 5000 soldiers from Around the Tent, Under the Tent, and the Trouble Relievers to be under the command of Commander Around the Tent Zhang Wen.
Left/Right Division Commander Under the Tent

按後漢書及季漢官爵考，光祿勳一职而分为二司，自五官將至羽林監，皆外朝宿衛，故以武職属，奉車都尉以下，与人主謀議，故以文職属
According to the Houhanshu and Examination of Ji Han’s officials and ranks: The Minister of Household was divided into two bureaus; From the All Purpose General to the Superintendent of Feather Forest, they were all outer court guards, hence subordinated by serving martial duties, those from the Commandant of Imperial Carriages onwards were closely involved in discussions with the ruler, hence subordinated by serving civil duties

通典：後漢並屬光祿勳。本不為官，奉朝會請召而已
Tongdian: In the Later Han subordinate under the Minister of the Household. Originally not an official position, only a privilege to receive the invitation to attend morning court sessions
掌御乘輿車，或以為加官
In charge of the imperial carriages, sometimes given as an additional title
Sixth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, not fixed

為三都尉
Known as the Three Commandants
In charge of the supplementary escorting horses and carriages, sometimes given as an additional title
掌羽林從騎，或以為加官
In charge of the attendant cavalries from the Feathered Forest, sometimes given as an additional title
凡大夫議郎皆掌顧問應對，無常事
All counsellors and Gentleman Consultants were responsible for providing counsel and answers, no regular duties

惟詔令所使，多養老疾，無實事
Only tasked by edicts and orders, often given to those of old age or suffering from illness, with no official responsibilities

漢以後為後備，不以參議諍諫為主，品秩雖低，名義清高
Became reserve officials after the Han, and advices and remonstrations were no longer their main role, although the rank was low, the position was associated with prestige and honor
掌大拜授及百官班次，或監鹽官
In charge of arranging major appointments and position of officials by ranks during court sessions, sometimes also supervise the salt officials
Fifth grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person

為謁者臺率
Leader of the Emissary Terrace
掌小拜授及百官報章，或鹽冶
In charge of arranging minor appointments and various officials' reports and memorials, sometimes administer salt operations
Manage retinue troops and shooting ceremonies
主御紙筆墨尚書財用諸物及封泥
In charge of imperial papers, writing instruments, inks, the Imperial Secretariat’s various items, and sealing waxes
Assistant to the Director of Palace Supplies
In charge of various eunuchs in the imperial palace

董巴：禁門曰黃闥
Dong Ba: The imperial palace gates are called the Yellow Gates
丞佐理宦者，從丞侍從皇帝出入
The Assistant aided in management of eunuchs, the Attendant Assistant served and followed the emperor in his movements.
Manage matters regarding Rear Palace Royal Consorts and female officials
Left/Right Assistant to the Director of the Lateral Courts
Similar to that of the Director of the Lateral Courts

清商為魏晉時期流行音樂
"Qingshang" is the name of a popular music during the Wei-Jin era

漢無此官，按諸令丞補
The Han did not have this position, details supplemented with reference to other directors and assistants
Assistant to the Director of Bell Music
中婦人疾病者，就此室治
Ladies in the palace who were sick would come to this house to get treated

皇后﹑貴人有罪，亦就此室
Empresses, Royal Consorts who were convicted, also came to this house for punishment
Director of the Magnificent Forest Garden
In charge of the Magnificent Forest Garden

本名芳林園，避少帝諱改名
Originally named Beautiful Forest Garden “Fanglin Yuan”, changed name to avoid Emperor Shao’s name taboo [Cao Fang]
掌宮門衛士宮中徼循事
In charge of the guards at palace gates and patrol matters in the palace
Assistant to the Commandant of the Guards
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
Director of Official Carriages at Sima Gate
掌宮南闕門，凡吏民上章，四方貢獻及徵詣公車亦由公車司馬
In charge of the watch tower gates south of the palace, all civilian petitions, tributes and summoning Official Carriages had to go through the director

洛陽南門為司馬門，此官或省司馬，但曰公車
The south gate in Luoyang is called the Sima Gate, this position sometimes can have the Sima abbreviated, only addressed as Director of Official Carriages

臣民求見天子由公車，天子徵召臣民亦以公車示禮遇
Officials and civilians wishing to meet the emperor had to go through the director, when the emperor summon officials and civilians, use of Official Carriages is also a sign of respect
Assistant to the Director of Official Carriages at Sima Gate
Assistant to the Director of the Guards
主劍戟士徼循宮及天子有所收考
In charge of soldiers patrolling the palace, aid the emperor when there are arrests and interrogations
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person each
Assistant to the Left/Right Palace Captain
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person per gate

九卿(二) Nine Ministers II.text:
通典：後漢九卿而分屬三司，太常、光祿勳、衛尉三卿並太尉所部；太僕、廷尉、大鴻臚三卿並司徒所部；宗正、大司農、少府三卿並司空所部。魏九卿與漢同。
Tongdian: The Later Han’s Nine Ministers were under the respective Three Excellencies. The Minister of Ceremonies, Minister of the Household, Commandant of the Guards were under the Grand Commandant; the Minister Coachman, Commandant of Justice, Minister Herald were under the Excellency over the Masses; the Minister for Imperial Clansmen, Minister of Agriculture, Minister of the Lesser Treasury were under the Excellency of Works. Wei’s Nine Ministers were the same as the Han.
掌車馬，天子每出，奏駕上鹵簿用，大駕則執御
In charge of chariots and horses, whenever the emperor travels, prepare chariots, retinues and ceremonial escorts, and personally control the grand carriage
In charge of imperial fields and hunts
In charge of border commanderies’ horses in managed reserves
主作兵器弓弩刀鎧之屬，及主織綬諸雜工
In charge of producing weapons, bows, crossbows, knives, armor and the like, and overseeing various artisans and craftsmen

成則傳執金吾入武庫
Upon completion, the products will be passed to the Bearer of the Golden Mace who will transfer them to the armory
Left/Right Assistant to the Director of the Imperial Workshops
Director of the Office of Carriages
In charge of various carriage vehicles
Assistant to the Director of the Office of Carriages
Assistant to the Director of Pastures
In charge of carriages and the horses in the stable

乘黃，古之神馬，因以為名。按魏都賦注，鄴城西下有乘黃廏
Chenghuang, divine horse of the old, hence named as such. Per annotations in Weidufu, down from the west of Ye city there was a Divine Horse Stable
Assistant to the Director of Divine Horse Stable
In charge of carriages and the horses in the stable
Assistant to the Director of Fine Horse Stable

按穆天子傳，驊騮为穆王八駿馬之一
Per Tale of King Mu, Son of Heaven, Hualiu is one of the 8 legendary fine horses of King Mu of Zhou
掌平獄，奏當所應，凡郡國讞疑，皆處當以報
Adjudicate and report the outcomes to the emperor, judge and administer punishments for difficult cases in the commanderies

魏、吳為王時為大理，称帝后改廷尉
When Wei and Wu were still kings they had Grand Judge, after ascension changed to Commandant of Justice
廷尉三官，皆掌平決詔獄
The Three Officials of the Commandant of Justice all adjudicate and manage the imperial prison

位次廷尉
Second to the Commandant of Justice
掌諸侯及四方歸義蠻夷其郊廟行禮，贊導
Manage rituals at the ancestral temples for the marquises and surrounding subjugated barbarian tribes,  announce arrival of guests

諸王入朝，郊迎，典其禮儀，及郡國上計亦屬。皇子拜王，贊授印綬。及拜諸侯﹑諸侯嗣子，及四方夷狄封者，臺下鴻臚召拜之。王薨，則使弔之，及拜王嗣
When the various princes/kings enter the capital, he is to welcome at the outskirts and lead ceremonies, also involved when the commanderies present their reports. When the imperial sons are enfeoffed as princes, he will announce and present the seals and ribbons. When the marquises and their sons, and the barbarian tribes from four directions are enfeoffed, he will represent the state in bestowing them. When princes/kings die, he will be sent to pay condolences, and enfeoff their descendants

舊曰典客
In the past called Director of Guests
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
主諸郎，治郡邸之在京師者
In charge of the various gentlemen, and manage the commandery officials' residences in the capital

本漢大行令，魏改今名
Originally the Han’s Director of the Messenger Office, Wei changed to this current name

按後漢書，大行令所主郎為治禮郎
Per the Houhanshu, the gentleman under the Director of the Messenger Office was the Gentleman for Administering Rituals

九卿(三) Nine Ministers IIII.text:
通典：後漢九卿而分屬三司，太常、光祿勳、衛尉三卿並太尉所部；太僕、廷尉、大鴻臚三卿並司徒所部；宗正、大司農、少府三卿並司空所部。魏九卿與漢同。
Tongdian: The Later Han’s Nine Ministers were under the respective Three Excellencies. The Minister of Ceremonies, Minister of the Household, Commandant of the Guards were under the Grand Commandant; the Minister Coachman, Commandant of Justice, Minister Herald were under the Excellency over the Masses; the Minister for Imperial Clansmen, Minister of Agriculture, Minister of the Lesser Treasury were under the Excellency of Works. Wei’s Nine Ministers were the same as the Han.
序錄王國嫡庶之次，及諸宗室親屬
Record the Dishu order among the royal family, and the relatives of the imperial clan

嫡庶制，正妻子為嫡，位高，側室子為庶，位低
By the Dishu system, the children of the official wife are Di children, ranked higher, and children of secondary spouses are Shu children, ranked lower
Assistant to the Minister for Imperial Clansmen
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
八品，六百石，每公主一人
Eighth grade, 600 dan, 1 person for each princess

萬戶以上者，第七品
Those under princesses with more than 10 thousand households would be of the seventh grade
Manage various taxes, grains, silks, and currencies

魏、吳為王時為大農，称帝后改大司農
When Wei and Wu were still kings they had Grand Agriculturist, after ascension changed to Minister of Agriculture
Assistant to the Minister of Agriculture
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
郡縣有屯田者置，主屯田以供軍糧，蜀惟屯漢中，他郡無考

Established in commanderies and counties with Agricultural Garrisons, in charge of Agricultural Garrisons to provide military supplies. Shu was only known to station at Hanzhong, unknown for other commanderies

魏諸典農官皆謂典農
Directing Agriculture is often the abbreviation for all Wei officials with the Directing Agriculture modifier

蜀又有督運
Shu also had Superintendent of Transport

按鄧艾傳，又有員吏稻田守叢草吏，功曹，綱紀，上計吏
According to Biography of Deng Ai, also had accessory officials Paddy Field Administrator Grass Thicket Clerk, Merit Section Assistant, Office Manager and Accounts Clerk
所主如中郎將，部分別而少者為校尉。吳制統諸縣如太守
Responsibilities similar to that of Gentleman-General, only that those with smaller divisions were Colonels. In Wu's system, Colonel command the various counties like a Grand Administrator
同，惟中郎將、校尉分列諸郡囯，都尉分列諸縣

Same as the others. Only that the Generals of the Inner Gentleman and Colonels were distributed among the various commanderies and state, whereas the Commandants were distributed among the various counties

有屯田都尉，或同。又有綏集都尉屯田事，無考
There was also Commandant of Agricultural Garrison, which might be the same position with a different name. There was also a record of the Commandant of Pacification and Settlement involved in Agricultural Garrisons, details unknown

(Wei) Manage various military farms
(Wu) In charge of military grains

吳節度不屬司農
Wu's Regulator was not the subordinate of the Minister of Agriculture
Sixth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person
In charge of receiving the grain transported by waterways from the commanderies and state
Assistant to the Director of the Imperial Granaries
In charge of pounding the imperial rice and preparing dry provisions

宋書：導，擇也。擇米令精也。
Songshu: To 導 Dao is to 擇 Ze (select). Select the grains to make them finer.
Assistant to the Director of Selection Officials
掌中服御諸物，衣服寶貨，珍膳之屬
Manage various garments and accessories in the palace, including clothing, treasures, delicacies and the likes

後漢書注: 少者小也，小故称少府。王者以租税为公用，山泽陂池之税以供王之私用。古皆作小府。
Houhanshu annotations: '少‘ (Lesser) means '小' (small), so it was called the '少府' (Lesser Treasury). Most of the taxes collected by the ruler were used for public purposes, but taxes from mountains, lakes, marshes and the likes were for the ruler’s private use. In ancient times, this personal treasury was called '小府' (Small Treasury)
Assistant to the Minister of the Lesser Treasury
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
In charge of all timber in the Realm under Heaven
Sixth grade, Equivalent to 2000 dan, 1 person

魏併左校于材官，則材官校尉兼主工徒也
The Wei combined the Left Workshop with Colonel of Construction, then the Colone was also responsible for craftsmen
In charge of various medical matters
In charge of the palace meals
In charge of cooking equipment and various sweet delicacies

別在外諸果菜茹
Select various fruits and vegetables from outside the palace
典宦者、官婢作中衣服補浣之事
Oversee eunuchs and maidservants in making clothing for the palace, and mending and washing matters
Assistant to the Director of the Imperial Wardrobe
典諸近池苑囿遊觀之處
Oversee various imperial ponds, grounds, gardens and other locations for touring and sightseeing
Assistant to the Director of the Imperial Parks

永安，北宮東北別小宮名，有園觀
Yong'an is the name of a small side palace to the northeast of the North Palace, has a garden
In charged of the detached palaces in the various Gardens

鴻池，池名，在雒陽東二十里
The Hongchi (Goose Lake), is the name of a lake, 20 li east of Luoyang.

洛陽宮有靈芝園，黃初三年十一月穿靈芝池，池有鳴鶴舟﹑指南舟
The Luoyang Palace had Lingzhi Garden, in the 11th month of the 3rd year of Huangchu excavated the Lingzhi Lake, the lake has ships named Minghe (Calling Cranes) and Zhinan (Pointing South)

Superintendent for the Zongzhang Platform

Superintendent for the Xima Platform

靑龍三年三月，大治洛陽宮，築總章觀，高十餘丈，建翔鳳于上。閣凡十三閒。戲馬無考，疑亦臺觀之名
In the 3rd month of the 3rd year of Qinglong, began large-scale construction of the Luoyang Palace and built the Zongzhang Platform. It was over ten zhangs tall, with soaring phoenix decorations erected at its top. There was a total of 13 chambers. Xima's reference is unknown, likely also a platform name like Zongzhang
In charge of the palace coins, silks, golds and silvers and various goods
Assistant to the Director of the Palace Treasury
Central, Left, Right Director of the Imperial Manufactory
Central, Left, Right Director of the Imperial Manufactory
掌上手工作御刀劍諸好器物
In charge of the emperor's handicraft items, produce swords, knifes and other items for the emperor's usage
Assistant to the Central, Left, Right Director of the Imperial Manufactory
掌知物價及主練染作采色
Oversee market prices, in charge of dyeing and color production

此官後漢屬大司農
This position in the Later Han was subordinate to the Minister of Agriculture
Assistant to the Director of Standards

其他 Others.text:
Bearer of the Golden Mace

Commandant of the Capital
掌宮外戒司非常水火之事，及主兵器。
Responsible for security outside the palace and extraordinary incidents involving fire and water, and oversees weapons

魏為王時為中尉，称帝后改執金吾
When Wei was still king they had Commandant of the Capital, after ascension changed to Bearer of the Golden Mace

月三繞行宮外
Patrol outside the palace three times a month
Assistant to the Bearer of the Golden Mace
Seventh grade, Equivalent to 1000 dan, 1 person
Assistant to the Director of the Armory
掌修作宗廟路寢宮室陵園土木之功，并樹桐梓之類，列于道側

Oversee the construction and repair works of ancestral temples, roads, palaces, royal residences, tomb complexes, and other architectural projects, as well as the planting of trees such as parasol tree and catalpas, aligning them by the roads
In charged of the laborers in the Right Workshop

左校掌營搆木作採材等事，右校掌營土作瓦泥并燒石灰廁溷等事。故魏并左校于材官，而右校仍屬大匠
The Left Workshop was responsible for constructing wooden structures, procuring timber, and related tasks, while the Right Workshop was responsible for earthworks, tile-making, as well as lime-burning and latrines management. Therefore, during the Wei, the Left Workshop was merged under the Colonel of Construction, while the Right Workshop remained subordinate to the Court Architect
